title: Why KAWS fans might be surprised by the artist's first solo London exhibition
text:
Within the past few years, Brian Donnelly – aka KAWS – the Brooklyn street artist and former toymaker, has become one of the best-known names in the art market, his cartoon-style paintings and Disneyesque sculptures rocketing in price.

KAWS, who has 2.5 million Instagram followers, is a particular hit in Asia where, in March, images of his 115ft inflatable Mickey Mouse-style figure floating in Hong Kong’s Victoria Harbour went viral. A few days later, on April Fools’ Day, a large painting based on the cover of the Beatles’ Sgt Pepper’s album, with the fab four looking like The Simpsons, surpassed a $764,000 estimate to sell for a multiple record $14.8 million (£12 million). Critics, however,...
